first_reading.text:
[[1_R 19,19]]Elijah set out, and came upon Elisha, son of Shaphat, as he was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen; he was following the twelfth. Elijah went over to him and threw his cloak over him.
[[1_R 19,20]]Elisha left the oxen, ran after Elijah, and said, "Please, let me kiss my father and mother good-bye, and I will follow you." "Go back!" Elijah answered. "Have I done anything to you?"
[[1_R 19,21]]Elisha left him and, taking the yoke of oxen, slaughtered them; he used the plowing equipment for fuel to boil their flesh, and gave it to his people to eat. Then he left and followed Elijah as his attendant.
first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings

psalm.text:
[[Ps 16,1]]Keep me, O God, for in you I take refuge;
[[Ps 16,2a]]I say to the LORD, "My Lord are you."
[[Ps 16,5]]O LORD, my allotted portion and my cup, 
you it is who hold fast my lot.

[[Ps 16,7]]I bless the LORD who counsels me; 
even in the night my heart exhorts me.
[[Ps 16,8]]I set the LORD ever before me; 
with him at my right hand I shall not be disturbed.

[[Ps 16,9]]Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices, 
my body, too, abides in confidence
[[Ps 16,10]]because you will not abandon my soul to the netherworld, 
nor will you suffer your faithful one to undergo corruption.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 5,33]]Jesus said to his disciples: "You have heard that it was said to your ancestors, 'Do not take a false oath, but make good to the Lord all that you vow.'
[[Mt 5,34]]But I say to you, do not swear at all; not by heaven, for it is God's throne;
[[Mt 5,35]]nor by the earth, for it is his footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
[[Mt 5,36]]Do not swear by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.
[[Mt 5,37]]Let your 'Yes' mean 'Yes,' and your 'No' mean 'No.' Anything more is from the evil one."
